intro: Glochidion tirupathiense, commonly known as the Tirupati hibiscus, is a shrub native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often pubescent. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its habitat.
